meanings.definition: A substance that propels or drives forward.
meanings.sent1: The rocket used a powerful propellent to launch into space.
meanings.sent2: The propellent in the engine helped the car move quickly.
meanings.sent3: The propellent in the water gun made the game even more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the propellent that drove her to success.
meanings.sent5: The propellent, like a magical force, pushed the boat across the water effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Something that propels or drives forward.
meanings.sent1: The wind acted as a natural propellent for the sailboat.
meanings.sent2: The propellent of motivation kept him focused on his goals.
meanings.sent3: The propellent of laughter propelled the mood of the party to new heights.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was the propellent behind his creative compositions.
meanings.sent5: The propellent of curiosity led her to explore new places and ideas.
